citation.article-title: Proposal of Yaniellaceae fam. nov., Yaniella gen. nov. and Sinobaca gen. nov. as replacements for the illegitimate prokaryotic names Yaniaceae Li et al. 2005, Yania Li et al. 2004, emend Li et al. 2005, and Sinococcus Li et al. 2006, respectively.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Yaniella [Ya.ni.el′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Yaniella named after Xun-Chu Yan (1912–1994), a Chinese microbiologist who devoted his life to the study of actinomycete taxonomy and antibiotics].
Previous illegitimate name: Yania Li et al. 2004.
The description of the genus is as given for Yania in Li et al. (2004) and in Li et al. (2005).
The type species is Yaniella halotolerans (Li et al., 2004).
